call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - June 26th

topics.title: Dexy Trading Status and Crystal Pools DEX
topics.summary: Discussion of Dexy as a financial game with arbitrage opportunities and introduction of Crystal Pools by C8 as a DEX aggregator. Crystal Pools allows interaction with multiple liquidity pools and applications like SigmaUSD Bank and Dexy Bank from a single interface.

topics.title: Oracle Pool V2 and DexyUSD Launch Timeline
topics.summary: Plans to update Oracle Pool to version 2 and launch Gluon USD followed by DexyUSD around September. Timeline includes testnet phase and need for liquidity providers, with Rosen bringing USD stablecoins from Ethereum.

topics.title: Decentralized Explorer Infrastructure Initiative
topics.summary: QX announces plan to transition from EF-funded hosted infrastructure to community-run decentralized explorer nodes. The initiative involves distributing high-performance machines globally through MewMart to volunteers who will host official explorer infrastructure with load balancing.

topics.title: Ergo Development Speed and Tooling Quality
topics.summary: Response to question about Ergo's rapid development pace, highlighting excellent developer tooling across multiple languages including Scala SDK, Python, and C#. Discussion of easy API access and database interaction options for developers.

topics.title: Aletheia Protocol Discussion and Anniversary AMA
topics.summary: Kushti mentions discovering the Aletheia protocol on Twitter and adding it to his reading list for review. Plans to provide comments either on the forum or during the upcoming anniversary AMA scheduled for July 1st at 2 PM UTC.

topics.title: Privacy Chain Statistics and Gini Coefficient
topics.summary: Technical discussion on the near-impossibility of calculating statistics like Gini coefficient on privacy chains while maintaining transaction and balance privacy. Explains theoretical solutions involving multi-party computation but practical limitations.

topics.title: Midnight Partnership and Private Sidechains
topics.summary: Discussion of upcoming call with Midnight team about potential collaboration. Ergo's interest in private sidechains for smart contracts, while Midnight shows interest in proof-of-work aspects. Exploration of merge-mined sidechains and partner chain concepts with Cardano.

topics.title: Ergo History and Development Philosophy
topics.summary: Reflection on Ergo's history as engineer-driven project similar to early Bitcoin, contrasting with typical crypto projects that start with marketing. Discussion of community growth and the unique bottom-up development approach.

topics.title: Privacy Stablecoin and Zephyr Protocol
topics.summary: Discussion of privacy stablecoins, mentioning Zephyr as a private implementation of Djed protocol that encountered issues. Suggests bringing established stablecoins like SigmaUSD to private sidechains as a more secure approach.

topics.title: Colorado Meetup Schedule and Storage Rent
topics.summary: Update on Colorado Springs meetup planning with finalized schedule and speakers. Discussion of integrating Cheese's storage rent modifications into the official node to simplify mining pool operations.

topics.title: Twin Coins Protocol Research
topics.summary: Explanation of Twin Coins research paper combining proof-of-work and proof-of-stake for enhanced security against 51% attacks. While theoretically sound, the protocol needs practical modifications and efficiency improvements for real-world implementation.
